main event: A driver observed a cigar-shaped object in the sky near Norristown, Pennsylvania, on January 13, 1959.
interesting points: The object was golden and appeared to descend slowly toward the horizon., The witness described the object as being about half the sun's diameter., Observations were made over a 60-minute period., The observation was made in clear weather with no sound reported., The witness was a reliable observer with a background in military training.
witness description: A Regular Army Infantry Officer with amateur radio experience since 1922.
